posts.content:
lowdown dirty rat wrote:I think it's always good to have the Beer in mind.
As barndoors were never really imported into this country in the same great numbers as other countries, i have always thought that our get togethers probably represent the greatest gathering of drunk idiot barndoor owners in one place in Britain EVER!


I hear ya dude Can't wait!

Barn Door list
1. Rikki James. 1954 Samba
2. Alan Scott. 1952 kombi ( rhd )
3. J D. 1954 UK delivered Kombi
4. Ben. 1954 kombi
5. Ben & Mo. One of them Barndoors
6. Ned & Vic. 51 standard if it's solid enough to trailer!
7. Wiskers. 54 Samba
8. Martin Coombes 54 Coke Cola
9. Michael Cooper 54 Kombi
10. Mike & Charlie. 53 panelvan
11. Craig & Holly 51 panel
12. Dai and Lou, 50 kombi
13. Rob Underwood 53 kombi
14. Michael John Riley 54 panel
15 . Peter Golding 51 opening rear hatch kombi I think !
16. Lee moorhouse 54 kombi
17. Karl & Susie The 54 Steiner Rad Samba
18 Chez and the brown hound 53 Kombi
Non Barndoor list
Christian Peck 60 Samba
I will try to bring the 52 Dlx.. Ian Mac
Excellent Ian, please add your self to the list fella.
My barn door has just arrived (finally!!) hope to get interior fitted weekend after next if all goes to plan will try to get along

Christian Peck 60 Samba
Mike and Susie 1959 Kombi

Hi Rikki,

Thought you may like to know that the bridge at Radcott is closed at the moment due to a lorry hitting it a couple of days back. It's due to be closed for three weeks but these things have a habit of dragging on. Should be finished before the big day but you may want to keep an eye on it just in case.

Provided access to the camping field is still open, the alternative route from the North would be via Lechlade and Faringdon.

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-ox ... e-33867075

Cheers

Will
Big thanks for the heads up Will!!

Non Barndoor list
Christian Peck 60 Samba
Mike and Susie 1959 Kombi
Caroline Harding 63 Canterbury Pitt

No probs Rikki,

In the mean time, if I hear that it's back open again, I'll let you know. We head across is every week (well, around it for now) for our dog agility classes (don't ask!) about a mile from there, so should know when it's sorted.

Best of luck with the gathering. Looks like a cracking BD list so far. We'd pop along as it's nearby but we're already showing our two at our local Northleach Steam & Vintage Fair on the Saturday!
